intro: Jasminonerium pubescens, commonly known as the woolly jasminoon, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires well-drained soil and full sun for optimal growth.
